mcm.theater
Class Play

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  javax.swing.JApplet
                      mcm.theater.Play
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class Play
extends javax.swing.JApplet

Play initializes a Stage and starts an initial Actor to run on that Stage. It can be executed as an Applet or a Java application that starts a frame window. It animates the Stage on the applet's or frame's window. The class name of the initial actor may be supplied through an applet or command line parameter.

To start a Play with an initial actor of the class Rectangle from the package sample as application from the command line type: 

  java mcm.theater.Play -actor sample.Rectangle
The above assumes that the CLASSPATH environment variable lists the folders/directories where the jar files containing the mcm theater and saverbeans packages reside.

To start the same actor in an applet define the following html file: 

  <applet code=mcm.theater.Play.class width="200" height="200" 
          ARCHIVE="mcmTheater.jar">
      <param name="ACTOR" value="sample.Rectangle">
  </applet>

As a third option classes may include a main method using Play's main method as follows: 

 public class Starter {
    public static void main(String args[]) {
    Play.main(args, new sample.Rectangle());
    }
 }

Author:
Monika Mevenkamp

Method Detail

getInitial

getStage

public Stage getStage()
Returns the play's stage. The stage remains null until the stage area has been fully initialized.

Returns:
null, or the play's stage

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
Called by the Java interpreter when Play is executed as application. The command line arguments must include "-actor <actorClassName>", where <actorClassName>; is the name of an Actor class with a default constructor. The main method creates a Play that instantiates and displays a frame window which serves as Stage. It instantiates the given actor class and starts that actor at the center of the stage.

Parameters:
argv - command line arguments

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv,
                        Actor a)
This main method starts a Play with the given actor as initial actor. The created Play instantiates and displays a frame window which serves as the stage. It creates a clone of the given Actor and starts that actor as the initial actor at the center of the stage. The command line arguments passed may be used to set the stage's default color, colors used by actors, their default trail width, .... Calling a Play with -help prints all available options.

Parameters:
argv - command line arguments
a - a template for the initial actor

start

public static Play start(Actor a)
Like the main method start starts a Play. It returns a reference to the Play it started.

Parameters:
a - a template for the initial actor
Returns:
the play that was started

start

public static Play start(int width,
                         int height,
                         Actor a)
Like the main method start starts a Play. It returns a reference to the Play it started. The width and height parameters determine the size of the stage.

Parameters:
width - the width of the stage/window started for the play
height - the height of the stage/window started for the play
a - a template for the initial actor
Returns:
the play that was started

start

public static Play start(java.lang.String[] argv,
                         Actor a)
Like main starts a Play.

Parameters:
argv - command line arguments, @link Play#main(String[], Actor)
a - a template for the initial actor
Returns:
the play that was started
